values:
In honour of my new business, new bed, and new newness, I thought I would create a new journal.

Everyone and their moms, please add my new journal at to your friends lists. merci beacoup.

Last night I went to Lee's to see the Scandelles valentines burlesque show. After going to last years, and seeing what an awesome show they put on, I couldn't miss this one.  Special thanks go out to Jeanine for joining me because even though i said i would go alone, I think i'd feel too awkward to actually do it.  I psyched myself up to go up onstage if they called audience members up to try dancing and tassle twirling, but then i chickend out because they expect you to get on the stage from the floor, which would have been an embarassing task for me (i'm so not a climber of anything). plus i was in a skirt and boots. so i made excuses instead of actually doing it. HOWEVER, they ended up not even doing the bareoke competition, so i didn't feel bad anymore for letting myself down. 

The show started off with a modern dance performance to some weird song, leaving me all, "i don't get it" but the rest of the show was a feast of sinuous flesh, fun, and allusions to fornication.  I was enamored with the positivity of it all, how everyone's body, sexuality, and identity was welcomed and celebrated. It was just such an uplifting experience. I can't really explain why. But i felt at home.  Anyway, I get to enjoy it all again tonight at the Harlettes show at the Revival.  Here's hoping its equally as tittilating!

I know this probably sounds lame, but I had such a great time hanging out with Teddy last night.  It just feels good to be around him. We didn't do anything special, he watched the superbowl and I did homework but it was just so nice to have him there. We're coming up on six months on the 9th and I think thats just crazy.

and so a business was born...

by a stroke of luck and genius, i came upon a name for my business. (for those not in the know, i'm in the process of starting my own business. i will be selling fun, stylish, edgy clothing for young, plus size women/girls online.)  for the past month i've been struggling to come up with one, written dozens of ideas and thesaurused my ass off.  but after brainstorming with rose last night, i found IT! YAYYY. how do i know its the one? well first of all, it just feels right.  second, i surveyed the 20 people in my class, giving them a few options i was considering, and all 20 unanimously selected this name. are you ready? haha. of course you are. drumroll please.........
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

Sweet Assets
ta da! its funny, its hip, haha, (u know ur old when you say something is hip), its good.

Anyway, now my question is, should i  include the words Clothing, +size Clothing, or something to that effect in the name? or should i just leave it as is, and have a tagline go under the name?  

I was thinking something like :

Not your mom's +size store
For women who don't want to apologize for their size

I just don't know if I should try to be obvious with the name so its more accessible, or keep it simple, let people wonder perhaps. Help a sistah out.

Any ideas/comments/suggestions are fully welcome.

p0isson party TONIGHT! @ the gladstone
Come on out to p0isson.com's first anniversary shindig, and party for a good cause. A $5 donation to the Make-a-Wish Foundation will get you in. Grab what's left of the 2006 clothing line at great prices and celebrate the launch of the 2007 line with an evening of DJs, dancing, sketch comedy, prizes, surprises and endless libations. Musical stylings will range from hip-hop and indie to '80s and disco, so be prepared to shake your money maker!!

I quit my job! Haha. Yes, after 1.5 weeks I quit the temp job at York.  Why? Welll......I got accepted! I applied to a government entrepreneur program and i got accepted.  So as of jan 2, i'll officially be working on my own business. YAY! I was really crossing my fingers that this would work out because I wanted out of the York job badly.  I basically opened mail for 7 hours a day, and there is no way i could handle that for 3 months straight.  Thats it for now! Happy holidays to everyone. 

I'm really excited for pot-luck dinner tomorrow!  But what the heck should i be making?!?!   Any suggestions, go ahead.

I got a job! Yay.  Its a 3 month contract with York U to work at the Admissions office where i'll be doing data entry, mail stuff, and whatever else people do in offices. Haha. Working full time is going to be a shock to the system.  I've never had an 8.30-4.30 job monday to friday. Plus i'm going to be probably putting in about 16 hours a week at the beer store on top of that. We'll see how long i can handle doing that for. I'm excited to actually start saving money to put aside for real life purchases like a place to live or a car or to start my business.

So my dad is currently in the ICU.  His surgery was scheduled for 4 hours but ended up being 8 hours long.  They removed a piece of his colon, fixed three hernias and removed his appendix.  Because he was under anaesthesia for so long they're keeping him in ICU to be under close watch.  They had him on a ventilator for the first night after surgery but removed it this morning when they realized he was breathing well enough on his own.  He's doing really well considering.  Especially considering everyone else in the ICU looks to be about 90 and on their death beds.  (they're actually pulling the plugs on two guys in there tonight).  He's in a lot of pain, but he just has to push a button beside him and morphine drips into his IV.  Its weird to see my dad like this.  In 53 years he's never been in a hospital as a patient.  He's a tough man.  I know he'll be fine.  Its just scary as all hell because this situation has been an unwelcome reminder of his mortality.  And that thought makes me ill.

Also, I have to admit, I'm a little disappointed that my close friends haven't really been making an effort to contact me to find out how he's doing or how i'm doing.  That stings a bit.

Surgery is scheduled for tomorrow.  They're going to cut out a section of his colon. It looks like everything should go well providing there are no complications.  Its not likely, but theres still a small chance.  *crossing fings*  I've been at the hospital all day for the past two days.  Tried to lunch with Paula but she was busy.  They run those nurses like crazy!  Thats all i gots for now.

My dad is still in the hospital.  For two and a half months he's been having issues with his intestines and has been seeing doctors, and been to the hospital, and had cat scans, and blood work, etc etc.  And nobody knows anything.  He had a colonscopy on Tuesday and since then, he has had some kind of blockage in his intestines, inhibiting him from making a bowel movement or passing gas.  Thats a week people, of no pooping, farting or burping.  Can you handle it? i couldn't.  I think my insides would explode....and basically it looks like his are about too.  His belly is so distended with gas, and the nurses pretty much haven't the slightest idea what to do and merely follow procedure.  I don't blame them.  The doctor that was supposed to see him has been in surgeries all weekend and was only able to talk to him today.  I don't blame him.  Its just really frustrating that it takes so much time and discomfort to be treated so long as you aren't an emergency. and while you're waiting, you very well could become an emergency that could have been avoided.  Blah blah.  Anyway, he's having an enema tomorrow, hopefully that works.  If not, he's going in for surgery.  I'll update when i know more. 

In other news, I'm trying to find a "real" job.  So if anyone has any leads or tips, lemme know!
i'm 99% sure i know where i left my jacket, which is such a relief. i have no idea if i'll be able to find it, but at least i know exactly where to look now.  YAY

i lost my winter jacket. i've only had it since last winter and i spent 180 bucks on it. and i really liked it. i remember having it in rose's car coming back from kid koala, i think i remember hanging it on my banister that night. saturday, i don't remember if i took it to the mall while shopping with my sis. she says she doesn't think i brought it either, but she doesn't remember. and i went to the lost and found at the mall yesterday, hoping, but i got nothing. WHERE IS IT?  blech. i feel gross.

also, car is officially getting scrapped saturday morning. hello bus. hello cabin fever.  goodbye freedom!  haha i feel like my life will be over after saturday.

Two things:

1) Today a wasp flew by the in door, managed to set off the automatic door opening sensor, and flew in.  

2) Someone must have cut off the viva bus i was on because the driver slammed on the brakes, causing me to slam into the guy beside me and a man to fall on my head. (I was sitting, he was standing)  After feeling mild embarassment, I almost laughed out loud because i thought it was hilarious.

This is what i have to update about. Got a problem? Haha. I'm lame.
Hey guys and dolls, who wants to go to this?

what do ya'll think of these shoes?  they're comfy as hell but they're 80 bucks.  eesh.  it doesn't help that i also really want a coat from le chateau .  Go to ladies jackets and coats, on the second page is a cream funnel neck coat.  *droolz*  its 189$ though. ay yi yi.

Thank fucking gods, goddesses and whatever else may be responsible, its NOT cancer. My dad has been having pain in his abdomen and trouble eating for a month now. In that month he's lost twenty pounds.  My mom took him to the er on saturday because he was vomiting and in pain. He's had a ton of tests done since then and this afternoon, my dad called from the hospital to say he had a cat scan and they found an enlargement in his colon.  I've been worried all weekend that it might be the dreaded "c" word and this was not news i wanted to hear.  So I freaked out and rode my bike to the hospital and once i got there he told me the doctor thinks its diverticulitis (http://digestive.niddk.nih.gov/ddiseases/pubs/diverticulosis/).  Basically, its an inflammation in the colon, possibly caused by infection that is not uncommon in people over the age of 50. He's on antibiotics for 10 days and that should clear it up.  I love my dad incredibly and the thought of not having him makes me stop breathing. Thank god its not cancer.

Teddy and I were talking about cream cheese when a memory came to me that I don't want to forget.  After my first shift at the Great Canadian Bagel (where I worked at the age of 16 or so? don't remember) I came home worried, almost in a panic as i described the day to my parents.  And I remember freaking out about the fact that when people ordered a dozen bagels, not only would i have to remember what types of bagels they wanted (what they looked like, what bin they were in--because the signs were facing the customers, not me), i'd have to remember how many were in the bag and SUBTRACT (heaven forbid) in my head the number of bagels they had left to choose.  Wow.  I am still terrible at subtracting (or any other math function for that matter) in my head when i'm on the spot and I have a moment of panic when the computer doesn't calculate the correct change for whatever reason while i'm cash.  Anyway, whats my point? I still freak out about stupid small shit like that at new jobs or in new situations.  And looking back, i think "how lame to invest energy into worrying about something so inconsequential!  It feels like the bagel story is going to be one of those things i use to personalize a speech i make to convince people not to fret over small hurdles in their life when i'm all big and powerful and influential. Haha

It's fun (or sad) to look back and know you haven't changed.  And i draw divisions in my head when i think about other people. Age wise mostly--like they're older, they're more advanced blah blah.  But really, we're all just people who do the same stupid shit we've always done.

Today I turn 24.  I'm on the cusp of change n'est pas?  It's the first september since kindergarten that I haven't gone back to school.  To quote an article i read recently: "Graduating is hard to do.  There's no orientation day. No schedules. No little map to help you find offices...I miss the arc of a semester, its natural slack start and piles of work in the middle, the kind of work that made you reach for some memory of working hard to get through it, lean on your friends and emerge victorious and exhausted sometime near Christmas."  It's definitely weird being out of school.  I'm still wondering when someone or something is going to club me over the head to wake me up and realize i gotta move on this life stuff. Saving money? moving out? getting a real job....er career.  Ack.  I'll set those thoughts aside until monday. After my party weekend is complete.

Five minutes into watching Little Miss Sunshine I knew I was going to want to buy the movie when it comes out (for the soundtrack alone). But the movie......Its amazing! GO WATCH IT!  I laughed while i cried. you know the drill. I highly recommend it. Hmm..i should totally get a job as a movie reviewer. they could pay me less since all of my articles would only be four lines long.

on the radio-regina spektor 

this is how it works
it feels a little worse
and when we drove our hearse
right through that screaming crowd
while laughing up a storm
until we were just bone
until it got so warm
that none of us could sleep

then all the styrofoam
began to melt away
we tried to find some worms
to aid in the decay
but none of them were home
inside their catacomb
a million ancient bees
began to sting our knees

while we were on our knees
praying that disease
would leave the ones we love
and never come again
and on the radio
we heard november rain
the solo's really long
but it's a pretty song
we listened to it twice
cause the dj was asleep

this is how it works
you're young until you're not
you love until you don't
you try until you can't
you laugh until you cry
you cry until you laugh
and everyone must breathe
until their dying breath

this is how it works
you peer inside yourself
you take the things you like
and try to love the things you took
and then you take that love you made
and stick it into some--
someone else's heart
pumping someone else's blood

and walking arm in arm
you hope it don't get harmed
but even if it does
you'll just do it all again
on the radio
you hear november rain
that solo's awful long
but it's a nice refrain
you listen to it twice
cause the dj is asleep
on the radio...

Teddy and I...some of it is so true..ALREADY (its only been a week)
There are times when Scorpio strides fearlessly into a challenging situation, and Virgo feels much more cautious and careful. Scorpio may consider Virgo to be too timid, and Virgo may feel that Scorpio lacks prudence. There are also many situations where Scorpio is more stubborn and persevering that Virgo. Scorpio may view Virgo's lack of commitment and dedication to a single purpose to be a sign of weakness. There is also the possibility that Virgo will view Scorpio as being a bit crude, too passionate or emotionally attached to certain situations or ideas. Virgo has refined sensitivities and sometimes literally doesn't like to get "dirty hands", while Scorpio is more primitive, raw, and un-squeamish. You both need to strive to harmonise your different natures and not antagonise each other.

Scorpio is quiet, deep, and complex emotionally, and often hides feelings or jealousy, guilt, and other powerful emotions out of fear of being misunderstood. Scorpio needs passion, drama, and intensity in order to feel completely alive, and may intentionally or unintentionally stir up personal crises or emotional storms in order to have those feelings. There is an underlying attraction to anything secret, dark, and mysterious, including the hidden or dark side of people. Negatively, Scorpio can be subtly manipulative and controlling, positively, Scorpio can be immensely loyal, and deep and faithful friend or lover.

Virgo is quite different from Scorpio in that Virgo responds logically and rationally to situations, rather than irrationally and instinctively as Scorpio does. There may be something in Virgo's background or in the way Virgo was raised that makes Virgo careful, shy, or restrained about being too emotional or sexual, and Scorpio's very intense feelings may be difficult for Virgo to understand or enter into.

Also, Virgo is quite self-critical and is therefore very sensitive to criticism from others, so Scorpio should be careful of lashing out or being sarcastic when in a stormy mood, as this hurts Virgo very much.

The two of you do share a tendency to probe and analyse yourselves and others, and a desire to change and improve yourselves as well.

Virgo's emotional responses to Scorpio are very intense. If Scorpio is physically attractive to Virgo, then the attractive power of Scorpio over Virgo is extremely powerful. However, the attraction tends to have a love/hate quality to it, and you feel drawn to each other, but also wary and distrustful of each other. It is likely that you feel both drawn to each other and repulsed by each other at the same time! The emotional response to each other is intense and complex, and the ultimate outcome of this deep, complex emotional tie is difficult to predict, but one thing is certain: this is not a lukewarm relationship and you "get under each other's skin", evoking intense feelings from each other. Virgo can easily become obsessed with Scorpio.

Romantic feelings are strong and you are very compatible sexually. It is unlikely that the feeling of being "in love" will ever fade completely, and it is likely that you will both see each other as someone very special and dear to you throughout your lives. Your relationship is definitely warm and romantic and very fulfilling for both of you.

The sexual attraction goes off with a "bang". You both arouse one another deeply. You are able to express your love with great conviction. You may enjoy many erotic devices and love toys that add extra spice to the relationship. Love talk and verbal affection may be particularly important to you.

The tendency to argumentativeness, verbal abuse, and mutual misunderstanding is very strong. Try to avoid abusive language towards each other, and do not try to coerce the other person to accept your views. You enjoy challenging each other's ideas, showing the weaknesses, inconsistencies, or superficialities in each other's reasoning. While the intention is good, the net result can be hurt feelings and anger. Typically there is some truth to each other's point of view, but a lack of real appreciation and respect for each other's ideas triggers argumentativeness.

Longevity, stability, mutual conscientiousness and dedication are essential aspects of your relationship. The two of you can build something very solid together. A focus on the practical, on financial security, and on taking care of duties, obligations, and responsibilities permeates your bond with one another. You foster the conservative in one another, and develop a togetherness that is peaceful, steady, more inclined to contentment than to flamboyance or fireworks. The only pitfall in all of this is a tendency to fall into established patterns of being with one another which eventually become too predictable and too easy to take for granted. Nevertheless you are destined to have a long-lasting relationship.

The two of you spark each other's sense of humour and good will. You usually put each other into a good mood, and you can count on lots of laughter, fun, and socialising to develop from this relationship. You feel open and uninhibited with each other, and a great appreciation for each other grows out of your happy times together.
We search for happinees in eager anticipation and joyful memories, but we're better off paying attention to each moment as it passes.

a few days ago, while walking my dog in the park, i was stopped by two young girls running toward me, asking to pet my dog. they asked questions and told stories about pets they knew and one girl mentioned how her cousins dog weighed 80 pounds. to which i replied "ya my dog is little, she only weighs 15 pounds".  that same girl said "i weigh 50 lbs" and her friend said "i weigh 90 pounds, i need to lose some weight" then she paused and said "and i'm only eight!" it was as if she knew how ridiculous that sounded to be worrying about her weight at such a young age. i wanted to scoop her up and tell her she's perfect just the way she is, but i thought that to be WAY too forward for a stranger. instead i said nothing. i really regret that. i always think of the best things to say after the fact. *sigh*. thats all.

yesterday my eyes welled up while i was mopping the floor at work because i couldn't remember john's last name. still attached. still so attached. fuckin get over it already will ya?

tomorrow is my last day of my undergrad career. i also have my last/only exam tomorrow on dance history. its worth 15% of my mark. i can't bring myself to care or study. cramps have sucked me of my energy and ITS THE LAST DAY! haha. seriously. i got 98% on my last exam in this class. so even if i only got 2 percent on my exam tomorrow...i'd still come out with a pass. yay

p.s. its bungay
I'm graduating?!?!?!
i have a date. oooo weee. i'm excited! (and i promised myself i will not let ANYTHING go past making out....need to keep him wanting mo!)

tonight i'm at jeanine's apartment watching tejha so that jeanine and colin could go to a masquerade ball at york. after work i came over, helped her pick out her outfit, ironed her pants, did her hair and makeup, while colin asked if his shirt needed to be ironed and if his vest looked okay with a missing button. i even gave them the keys to my car so they wouldn't freeze their asses off walking to york. i was purely a proud parent on prom night, without all the picture taking and crying. i even did her dishes and swept the floor. can you tell i'm bored? haha. but i'm glad i'm staying in tonight.

i don't know if the fact that yesterday was friday the 13th had anything to do with it, but i had an amazing time downtown last night. it was the 20th birthday of a girl in my dance class and she invited me to come out with her and her friends (along with two other girls from our class). i got all dolled up, went over around 9.30 and her mom and sister and like 14 other girls were all talking and making daquiri's and there was a huge spread of appetizers. way better than i'd treat anyone who came to my house. haha. we took a limo down and our driver tried to con us out of an extra hundred bucks than we'd been quoted. he also braked and accelerated way too quickly causing everyone to feel nauseaus and one of the girls to puke in the ice bucket. luckily it had a lid. we went to inside and because we showed up in a limo we had a bouncer open the car door, hand us all tickets to get in free, and we bypassed both of the lines. now, the last time i went to inside i was the one standing in line bitching cuz they kept letting limo fulls of people inside while they made us wait. it was nice but awkward to be on the other side of the fence. we get in the club, and sure enough theres no one there. eventually they started letting people in and it got real busy real fast. drinks were only 3.50 at one bar and 4 at another. after reading a slew of terrible reviews of the club on clubcrawlers.com i thought i was in for a horrible time. but it was supah. the girls that i know from class are dancing fiends and that made me even more excited to shake my ass. eventually we were sweating buckets and being pushed in every direction so consuelo and i went to the patio to cool off and so i could have a butt. unfortunately, the patio was not outside like i imagined, but had a roof and heatings blasting. i think it was hotter up there. needless to say we stood around and then two guys tried to pick up consuelo (both friends, and both at the same time) but one of the guys was respectable because instead of only talking to her he pretended he wanted to know me too and we had a conversation. he also got both our numbers but i'm sure he'll only be calling consuelo. another bonus of that club, the ratio of guys to girls is like 3 to 1! haha heaven. when we were on the dance floor this guy came into our circle and started showing off some sweet moves in the centre. and he'd stop and his friend would do some shit, but eventually his friend left and we kept dancing. so he was kinda dancing with me, trying to get me into a kind of dance off. he would do some cool moves, i'd copy them half assed or do something else. it was fun. haha i pictured it being something you saw in a movie. but my skills weren't even close to his. i enjoyed it nonetheless. they started playing shitty music so i went to the lounge area to rest and who do i see but our limo driver. he's standing in the corner smiling and watching us dance. and he's not young either. definitely over 40, very out of place. he told us before we went into the club that we had to be outside and ready at 2am on the dot or he would charge us 100 bucks more. so we're all outside and waiting at 1.50 and the fucker doesn't come out of the club until after 2. plus we thought he may have been drinking cuz of how happy he seemed in the club so while we were waiting for him one of the girls asked a police officer to come over and speak to him and suss out whether he was intoxicated or not. good ol police. after he came out and we all got in the limo they came over to speak to him. obviously they didn't think he was drunk cuz we went on our merry way. its sad that we had to leave so early though. just as soon as we were getting ready to go they started playing really really good reggae/soca. oh well. all in all i had an awesome night. i always say that friday the 13ths can be crazy good or crazy bad. for me they usually turn out to be crazy good. lets keep it that way!!

ahh lj. happy new year to ya! for those who don't know, it is a pipe dream/fantasy of mine to be a burlesque dancer. even though i haven't the slightest clue how to be one. i do bellydance once a week though and last month my instructor asked me if i wanted to perform in her show. i said i wasn't ready/good enough and declined the invitation. the show never ended up happening, and it has since been rescheduled for february fourth. she asked me again today and this time i'm seriously considering it. it would mean that in three weeks i'd have to pick a song, choreograph a dance, practice then perform. automatically i thought, NO WAY I CAN'T!!! but now i'm starting to think if i actually do ever want to perform burlesque, this is a great friggen start. babysteps. so i told her maybe. but i need some kicks in the ass. so everyone, feel free to push me!

i feel low when i search for men online. its not just about getting dates. ultimately, i seek justification, acceptance, approval, validation. i want to feel wanted, even if by strangers. when i don't meet anyone, or have meaningful conversations, i feel stupid, sad and as though i'm wasting my time. i message guys that i think are interesting and they rarely respond which leaves me waiting and feeling as if i'm not good enough for anybody I want. feel that i have to sit and wait for someone else to want me and then sift through the bullshit to see if they are worthwhile. (96% of the time...they are not). deserately seeking that connection. this was supposed to be fun. now it feels desperate and hopeless and yet without it i feel as if i have no options. a crutch. where else can i go? what else can i do? how else will i pass the time? how unattractive is desparation? VERY! the more i look, and the harder i try, the less i find. from now on, if browsing profiles and chatting to peeps makes me feel anything less than entertained or excited, then its time to get off the fucking internet!

also. i hung out with john last night. went for tea, talked at his place, fooled around, slept beside each other. this morning, when i woke up i cried. it was weird...maybe i was dreaming but don't remember. listening to sigur ros first thing in the am didn't help. but anyway..i skipped a part. in two weeks he's going back home to newfoundland, and from there who knows where he's going. i doubt i'll ever see him again. and i honestly never thought it would affect me this much. i guess i've always left a place for him in my heart (even while my head knew nothing was ever going to happen) and its sad to know that whatever we had will be no more. its like the end of an unrelationship. if that makes sense. no more bootycalls, no more warm body to lay beside and listen to fall asleep. sigh.

.

..

...

..

.

i said SIGH! haha.

must update for own sake..ahhh. so much to say. what a good weekend! it was my mom's 50th birthday on saturday so my dad planned a surprise weekend of fun. saturday night we went to see the just for laughs comedy tour at massey hall. i was pumped. my mom's depression has been getting steadily worse as it gets darker and colder, and i know the value of a good laugh so i was excited to see her laugh and enjoy. one guy was a bit boring, but the other five comics were amazing! i especially loved ryan belleville (the youngest, and by far cutest, but also the most fun). the host, shaun majumder (of this hour has 22 minutes) picked out this kid near the front of the audience to pick on. because he was only fifteen, he called him pubes, and for the rest of the show he made references to pubes and even the other comics would address him as pubes. and at the end of the night after thanking all the comics and sponsors they thanked pubes too. i can't describe how funny it was. i was crying from laughing and my cheeks literally hurt after. and, in traditional $teph style, i snorted! i never do that! you just have to see it for yourself. it was pretty expensive at 65 bucks a ticket, but i think it was worth it. which reminds me i have tickets to yuk yuks guys SO LETS GO SOON!!!!!!
uhm, what else. oh ya, during my last dance studio class we had a guest teach us contact improv (which, in the barest definition is two people doing free flowing, improvised movements involving touch in some way). one of the activities we had to do was hold the wrists of our partner and both lean back, so that we were holding each other up and balancing our weight. it was a really cool experience, especially when we had to do it with our eyes closed, because the balance would change and you'd have to read your body to get it back. anyway, getting to the point, at one point we were told to get down on all fours, and ground ourselves so that our partner could sit on our backs and move around on us (my partner did a kind of laying down backflip off my back). when it came time to switch, i was like theres no way i'm sitting on you. she's like don't worry, i'm strong. and i said i really don't feel comfortable, i'll crush you. stuff like that. now i don't know if you've noticed, but i'm not a small girl. (i'm kidding...about the not noticing part). haha. i'm definitely the biggest in the class. but my partner just kept telling me to just do it. so i did. at first i just straddled her, keeping my feet on the ground. and she told me to take them off, so i did. i was pretty much sitting on her back with my legs straight over her shoulders. it felt so cool! i asked if she was okay a couple times as i moved into different positions and she said she was fine. this probably doesn't seem like anything big to anyone else, and i'm mostly inscribing it just so i won't forget, but it was another step forward in my journy of body acceptance and confidence. i told the teacher this afterward, and thanked her for the experience and she seemed really happy about that. all of the activities combined, being that physically close to near strangers was a lesson in trust and human behaviour as well. its unfortunate that i only seem to get to experience these eye-opening things in a classroom setting (i mean how often do you get to slide around on the floor, or concentrate on belly breathing as a group, or sit on someones back?!), and that they don't happen more frequently but i'm glad i get to do it nonetheless!

i'm currently babysitting by myself. so far so good. no cries. but man does her poop STANK! i'm talkin she's fartin up a storm and when she's done i changed her butt and even after i threw the offending diaper outside, the room still smells like arse. but i forgive her cuz she's so effin cute.

ever since going to the art show/queenshead on thursday night i've felt so out of place among my own friends.  very distant. i don't feel like i belong. i don't feel fun. i don't know what to say. its like the less frequently i see them the more awkward it is. so i've retreated and become hermit-like. and i hate it. i feel like even more of a loser than before. this has gotta stop!

woah ho ho and a bottle of rum. hello journallers. just in case there's anyone on here who'd like to know (and doesn't already) it is my birthday on thursday and i would love love love love it if you would join me at system soundbar that night. its been a while since i've shaken my ass in a club so i'm very excited.

in other news. i'm lazy so this will be succinct. uhm. school started last week. it was fun as hell the first day. second day kinda sucked. i've been working a bit more, picking up shifts in maple. which is super since i owe my padu 960 bones. what else. friday night..you know what i just noticed..isn't it weird that we say friday night. if its friDAY how can it be night? it should be friday and frinight. and frimorning. anyway..frinight i went to dance cave with jen for her friends bday party. i felt awkward and socially inept 96% of the time. i followed her around like a puppy. i knew one guy (someone i work with) but interestingly, he spent more time talking to jen (whom he didn't know) than to me. sorry jen, don't mean to make you feel weird by writing this here...but i felt like a big nobodyyyy that night. this put me into kind of a funk the next day. which was compounded by the fact that the boy i met last week (and like) decreased his efforts to communicate with me. the past few days have been kinda hellish (caused by my impatience and menacing thoughts) because we haven't really been in touch. i was feeling shitty so i stayed home sat night until 2am when i talked to john and decided to sleep over at his house. i needed the chemical release that comes from cuddling. it worked. i feel fine. i guess this wasn't so succinct after all. i have homework to do already i'm behind cuz i don't have any books. hehe. starting the year off right as rain. whats up with that saying? anyone know where it comes from? fin.

I HATE READING GOOD BOOKS! why? for the simple and obvious fact that they end! what the hell! haha. i don't want to stop reading if i love the book. i want it to continue forever. have the main character live until old age. pass away. and then continue the story following their child. haha. i just finished a really good book. she's come undone by wally lamb. 450 pages feels like nothing when the text can make you scream, laugh and cry. when i read that the main character (Dolores) was divorcing her terrible husband i heaved a sigh of relief and FELT SO FREE! wows. so anyway...

this friday is jeanines birthday and saturday sherika has arranged for everyone to go to ceasers. a male strip club somewhere in toronto. should be hella weird but also hilarious times. its 4 am. do you know where your parents are? mine are in bed. i should be too. GOOdnight.

p.s. summer is almost over. this makes me hurt inside.

i hate john. no, i don't. i hate that i still think about him. i hate that i wonder if he has a girlfriend or is seeing someone new. i hate that he never comes online, doesn't answer his phone (the whole 3 times i've called), doesn't call back (he has caller id) and i hate how i wonder if he's avoiding me. or if he's blocked me. or just that he has a life outside of work and the internet that i don't know about. i hate how i saw a message on his campuskiss profile directed to another girl and i checked out her profile and compared her to myself. i hate thinking these things. i hate that tears still well up in my eyes since it happened months ago and we weren't even "dating". i hate the fact that my stomach still flips when i see his smile. and i hate how i still think he's hot. and yet i still don't regret meeting him. if i hadn't, i wouldn't have had the chance to experience any of the good i felt. even if it was followed by lots of bad. i hate that i sound really obsessed with him. haha. i'm not. just sometimes these things pop into my head and make me feel like ASS

Good = drinking the last bit of chocolate milk from the carton.

Bad = realizing the milk you just drank was sour by the aftertaste of rotten carcasses left in your mouth.

lately i've been feeling like crap physically. i wake up tired every day no matter how many hours of sleep i get, i get neck pains, back pains, leg pains, ankle pains. i know its a result of getting absolutely no physical activity. so this morning i woke up, did some stretching under the hot shower, and had a cup of green tea (it cures what ails ya...even if it is the placebo effect) and now i feel very relaxed and refreshed. yay!

providing this guy calls, i have an internet date tonight. wooot. that is all.

so i got so excited about the burlesque show, told everyone and their dog about it, got dolled up for like two hours with jeanine and my sis and of course, just like prom years ago, i was let down when i got there. it was a fun night, don't get me wrong, my expectations were just too high. i expected more people. a bigger venue. to get drunk. to flirt with some mens. the only man i talked to was melanies brother steve. haha. i'm gonna try not to get so excited about anything ever again! haha. i'll go into everything thinking its gonna be shit that way it can only go up from there. yea..that ain't possible.

i also wish that there had been a raised stage because it was hard to see the girls, even while standing. one of steve's friends was actually in the show and it was her first performance. i asked her how much balls it took to get on stage and do that and she said she was shaking uncontrollably. i didn't notice at all. i was just in awe of all the girls, especially miss mitzy creme. she just looked like she was having so much fun. they had a "surprise" guest who was a topless bellydancer. all she did was twirl around with a veil and i thought that ain't bellydancing! i so wanted to go up there and dance. in time, perhaps i will be up there!

today was my day off so i made an appointment with danny at reactive ink to get touched up. i headed downtown with jeanine and when i got there he looked at my back, said it looks really good and didn't see anything that needed touching up. haha. i was like crap! because i can't really see my back i couldn't tell beforehand if anything needed touching up. jeanine, tejha and i went on to have lunch at new sky for only FIVE BUCKS each...i got hot and sour soup, an egg roll and singapore style vermicelli. it was delicious. dwayne (tejha's dad) met up with us and from there we went to queen east in search of this place called studio one. i was told that i could find cheap body piercing jewelry there and i wanted to try a barbell to see if that would make my nipple piercing heal. i went in with jeanine and knew i had no clue what size i wanted so i asked the guy if he wanted to just look at it for me. then i found out that i would either be exposing my boob to a surveillance cam or, if i turned away from its sight i'd be facing the window. the guy gave me the gauge measurer and instructed me on how to do it myself. did it in a flash and seven dollars later i got my barbell. as we were leaving jeanine noticed a price list for piercings outside the shop that was right beside studio one. she was tempted to get her nipple pierced cuz it was only 50 bucks. we spoke to a guy that worked there who was having a butt and she was excited but unsure. we walked around some more looking for food for dwayne and she actually decided to do it! we went back and i got to see her get it done (thanks for letting me g!). the piercers hands were shaking cuz he was having trouble pushing it through smoothly. i was just like OWWW watching. haha. anyway, after sweating out 40 gallons of water we decided it was high time to go home. got stuck in crazy traffic *barfs* on the way back. i got caught in the storm and my windows completely fogged up so i couldn't see a thing. i had to pull into a parking lot and wait for the rain to stop. wow now i see why i don't update often. this isn't exactly exciting journal material.

in other news, this weekend was fun times. friday night i stayed in and then decided to drive out to berts at 2 in the morning. on the drive home at 5 i was slapping myself to stay awake. saturday was geoffs bday bbq, i got tipsy and conversed with people i wouldn't normally converse with. last weekend i went out for dinner with my sister and she gave me a challenge. i had one week to start a conversation with a stranger that lasted at least three minutes long. i completed that task one day last week at work in talking to the hot dog vendor outside of no frills. but at geoffs bbq i saw graham, the guy i attempted to hit on the first time i met him at milwaukees when i was drunk. i wanted to talk to him, but felt awkward so eventually i said "just dooo eeet" so i got up, sat beside him and we talked for a while. gooo meee! i'm giving up on plans to go to hillside festival. its like asking people to go to hell with me or something. so now i have the weekend off july 22-24. somebody. somewhere. lets do something FUN!!!! PLEASE!! enough begging.

sunday night i went to the steam whistle party and finally got to meet . he was shorter than i imagined (but still taller than me) and had the best hair. i was so close to riding a mechanical bull that night but the skirt i was wearing said "if you do, i'll flash the crowd!!" so i decided not to.

one last thing. on saturday july ninth i'm going to a burlesque show with jeanine and my sister. tickets are 15 bucks or 25 for two people. i'm not sure if i've mentioned this before on here but...if you want to come, lemme know i can buy more tickets online. if you dress up you get a free goodie bag and i'll be busting the corset that night. you should all pay fifteen bucks just to see that shit yo! haha. peace.

so i'm sure i'll be dead before summer ends. why's that you ask? because i seem to hurt myself at work every day. yesterday i dropped a pallet on my finger trying to help my manager move it. nothing broke. nothing serious. just fucking killed! and today, i was talking to a customer and said "have a good day" as he was leaving and he said "as long as i'm upright its a good day" and i laughed, and walked out from behind the counter and then my ankle collapsed and i fell on my hands and knees. spraining my ankle. thats the third time for old lefty. (the name of my ankle). i proceeded to work the rest of my 8 hour shift not realizing just how bad my ankle was until i got home. so maybe this means i won't have to work 11 days in a row. YAY.

other than stories about work, ghostface has pretty much got nothin. sorry peeps. life is dry right now.
